description: Take next group of 3 primes, beginning at 7, map final digits to base 4 by 1->0, 3->1, 7->3, 9->2; convert back to decimal.
comments: The index corresponds to the n-th triplet of primes, thus offset is 2 since we discard the first prime triplet (2,3,5).
references: Hans Paul van den Haag used this coding in Scientific American, German Edition, 4/1996 P.23.
links: Index entries for sequences related to final digits of numbers
mathematica: p3[c_]:=FromDigits[(Mod[c,10])/.{1->0,3->1,7->3,9->2},4]; p3/@ Partition[ Prime[ Range[4,220]],3] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Dec 15 2014 *)
prog: (PARI) cod(d) = if (d==1, 0, if (d==3, 1, if (d==7, 3, if (d==9, 2))));a(n) = cod(prime(3*n-2) % 10)*4^2 + cod(prime(3*n-1) % 10)*4 + cod(prime(3*n) % 10); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Aug 16 2013
author: Armand Turpel (armand_t(AT)geocities.com, armand(AT)vo.lu)
extensions: Offset changed from 7 to 2 by _Michel Marcus_, Aug 16 2013
